```{r load-data, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, class.source = 'fold-hide'}

url_root <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/UN-AVT/kamino-source/main/sources/0-shared/data/"
url_file <- "broadway/grosses.csv"
url <- paste0(url_root, url_file)
df <- read.csv(url, header = TRUE, nrows=20)
df

```


### Is alpha

Checking if the cells in the first column contain letters, and only letters (a-zA-Z). We can use the function <kbd>grepl()</kbd>

```{r is.alpha, echo=TRUE, message=FALSE}

a <- df$show

df_1 <- grepl("^[a-zA-Z ]*$", a, perl = T)
df_1

```


As you can see, only cell 18 contains letters, the other cells contain numbers or other characters.
